description:
For those who have 64 bit version of ubuntu and problem with Open Arena:
Try to download Open Arena from official site http://www.openarena.ws/download.php?view.4
Unzip file and run 'openarena.x86_64'
Downloaded version (0.8.8) works fine on my computer, while open arena from ubuntu repository have same bug as described in many reviews here.
If this review help please vote(click Yes) so other can see it.
Errors from the start

.openarena/baseoa/crashlog.txt:

...
Sys_LoadGameDll(/usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so) failed

Install this package then download openarena-0.8.8.zip from https://sourceforge.net/projects/oarena/files/
Extract the zip 
Copy the contents of the zips baseoa directory over the installation files:
sudo cp ~/zip_extract_dir/baseoa/* /usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/

My kids and I love the CTF LAN games.
Enjoy
crash on launch

running quake engine from ~2012, there's multiple exploits in the engine that allow remote code to be executed; which was fixed years ago. if you want to install this program, i recommend using the flatpak version instead, since it is sandboxed.

description:
Works!
fedora34
love it lots of good fun

Doesn't work on OpenSuse Tumbleweed. Terminal returns with error: 
"Segmentation fault (core dumped)"
VM_Create on UI failed. See "/home/rodney/.openarena/baseoa/crashlog.txt" for details. This is what happens everytime I tried to run this.

I got the following error on launch:
"VM_Create on UI failed. See "/home/user/.openarena/baseoa/crashlog.txt" for details."
Logfile error seems to be:
--
Loading DLL file /usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so instead.
Loading DLL file: /usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so
Sys_LoadGameDll(/usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so) failed:
"Failed loading /usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so: /usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so: undefined symbol: __atan2_finite"
Failed to load DLL /usr/lib/openarena/baseoa/pak6-patch088/uix86_64.so.
----- Client Shutdown (Client fatal crashed: VM_Create on UI failed) -----
--
Need I say more?
It would be nice if this didnt crash immediately with vm create failed.

runs very well on dell 7757 ubuntu 18.04
runs well on low speced devices like my latitude e4300. fun. very cool

The game is highly optimized and very fun to play. There are a few odd wrinkles with it, like for example by default the server type is set to "local" and you'd have to switch it to "internet" in order to see internet games. This isn't the end of the world but may cause some less patient/observant people to think there weren't multiplayer servers. Also, for some reason the game behaves strangely for me when in full screen mode on multi-monitor setups. It works in windowed mode just fine on such a setup so perhaps the problem likes with KDE. Not sure.
